text.p: Italian debt markets ended firm as the market held its breath in the expectation the lira would return to Europe's exchange rate mechanism at the weekend.
"It looks like it'll be re-entry this weekend," one broker at a London investment bank said.

The EU's monetary committee will meet on Saturday to discuss the lira's re-entry and Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio said the Italian government had requested to return after four years floating free.
The lira itself was trading chirpily up at 998.45/8.95 per mark, the area it has held for the last coupld of days.
The December Btp futures contract on LIFFE was 65 basis points higher at 127.92 and the July 2006 Btp was 23 basis points firmer at 108.77.
Economists and traders speculated whether the Bank of Italy might move to trim interest rates as early as this evening with inflation data and ERM re-entry as the possible spurs.
Others said however the central bank might wait until after an ERM return in order not to hit the currency with too many extraordinary influences at one go.
Preliminary inflation data from 10 sample cities showed Italy's year on year November CPI at 2.6 percent.
October's final CPI was 3.0 percent. The final November data is due on December 5.
Analysts said BTP futures had limited scope for gain with lira re-entry as any rally might be met by profit-taking as investors kept an eye on their books ahead of the year end.
